title: How to Make a Degree Symbol

steps.title: Click where you want to add a degree symbol.
steps.content: Click where you want to add a degree symbol. The quickest way to add a symbol to text is to use keyboard shortcuts. You can use Alt codes in Windows. Mac computers have their own keyboard shortcut . You can also use special shortcuts in Word and Excel. Click where you want to add a degree symbol in an email , social media post, private message, or any text document.

steps.title: Press ⇧ Shift+⌥ Option+8 on Mac.
steps.content: Press ⇧ Shift + ⌥ Option + 8 on Mac. If you are using a Mac computer , press Shift + Option + 8 at the same time to add a degree symbol to your text.

steps.title: Press ⇧ Shift+Ctrl+@ followed by Space in Microsoft Word.
steps.content: Press ⇧ Shift + Ctrl + @ followed by Space in Microsoft Word. If you are using Word , you can add a degree symbol by typing Ctrl+@ followed by the Spacebar.

steps.title: Type =CHAR(176) in Microsoft Excel.
steps.content: Type =CHAR(176) in Microsoft Excel. If you are using Excel , you can add a degree symbol by typing "=CHAR(176)" in a cell.

steps.title: Press and hold Alt and type 0176 on Windows with a numeric keypad.
steps.content: Press and hold Alt and type 0176 on Windows with a numeric keypad. If you are using a Windows computer that has a 10-key numeric keypad on the right side, press and hold the Alt key while typing 0, 1, 7, and then 6 on the keypad. Don't use the number row at the top. When you release the Alt key, you should see a degree symbol added to your text. [1] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source If this does not work, press the "Num Lock" key and try again.

steps.title: Click where you want to add a degree symbol.
steps.content: Click where you want to add a degree symbol. This can be any app that allows you to write text. It can be an email, social media post, private message , or text document.

steps.title: Press the Windows key + the period key.
steps.content: Press the Windows key + the period key. Pressing the Windows key and the Period (.) key at the same time displays the Emoji keyboard in Windows.

steps.title: Click Ω.
steps.content: Click Ω . It's the symbol that resembles a horseshoe symbol at the top of the Emoji keyboard. This displays symbols.

steps.title: Scroll down and click º.
steps.content: Scroll down and click º . Locate the degree button in the list of symbols and click it to add a degree symbol to your text.

steps.title: Click the Start menu.
steps.content: Click the Start menu. It's the icon with the Windows logo in the lower-left corner. [2] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Type in character map.
steps.content: Type in character map . This will search your computer for the Character Map program. [3] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Click Character Map.
steps.content: Click Character Map . It's a triangular app icon at the top of the Start window. Doing so opens Character Map. [4] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Check the "Advanced view" checkbox.
steps.content: Check the "Advanced view" checkbox. You'll find this box near the bottom of the Character Map window. If the "Advanced view" checkbox is already checked, skip this step.

steps.title: Search for the degree sign.
steps.content: Search for the degree sign. Type "degree sign" into the "Search for" text box near the bottom of the window, then click Search . The Character Map's page will clear, and only the degree symbol will remain. You can also find the degree symbol in the sixth row of the Character Map window when you first open Character Map.

steps.title: Double-click the degree symbol.
steps.content: Double-click the degree symbol. It's in the upper-left corner of the Character Map window.

steps.title: Click Copy.
steps.content: Click Copy . This option is to the right of the "Characters to copy" text field.

steps.title: Go to a place where you want to type the degree symbol.
steps.content: Go to a place where you want to type the degree symbol. This might be a text document, a post on social media, or an email.

steps.title: Press Ctrl+V.
steps.content: Press Ctrl + V . This pastes the degree symbol that you copied.

steps.title: Go to the place where you want to type a degree symbol.
steps.content: Go to the place where you want to type a degree symbol. Open the app, document, or website into which you want to type a degree symbol, then click the text field where you want to type it.

steps.title: Click Edit.
steps.content: Click Edit . This menu item is at the top of the screen. A drop-down menu will appear. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Click Emoji & Symbols.
steps.content: Click Emoji & Symbols . You'll find this option at the bottom of the Edit drop-down menu. Doing so opens the Character Viewer window. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Click the Punctuation tab.
steps.content: Click the Punctuation tab. It's on the left side of the Character Viewer window. You may first have to click the "Expand" icon, which is a box-shaped icon in the top-right corner of the window.

steps.title: Find the degree symbol.
steps.content: Find the degree symbol. The degree symbol is in the third row of symbols, just right of the ^ symbol. There is a larger degree symbol on the right side of this same row if the one on the far-left is too small for you.

steps.title: Double-click the degree symbol.
steps.content: Double-click the degree symbol. This will insert one degree symbol into the text field in which your cursor is placed.

steps.title: Click where you want to add a degree symbol.
steps.content: Click where you want to add a degree symbol. On Chromebook and Linux , you can add a degree symbol using Unicode symbols. Click the input field that you want to add a degree symbol to. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Press ⇧ Shift+Ctrl+U.
steps.content: Press ⇧ Shift + Ctrl + U . This displays an underlined " u " in the text.

steps.title: Type 00B0 on Chromebook or B0 on Linux.
steps.content: Type 00B0 on Chromebook or B0 on Linux. This is the Unicode for the degree symbol.

steps.title: Press Space or ↵ Enter.
steps.content: Press Space or ↵ Enter . This converts the underlined " u " to a degree symbol.

steps.title: Open an app that uses the keyboard.
steps.content: Open an app that uses the keyboard. You can add a degree symbol using your iPhone's or iPad's keyboard, but you'll need to switch to the correct view first.

steps.title: Place your cursor where you want to type the degree symbol.
steps.content: Place your cursor where you want to type the degree symbol. Tap a text field (e.g., the iMessage text field) into which you want to type the degree symbol. The keyboard should appear.

steps.title: Tap 123.
steps.content: Tap 123 . This button is in the lower-left corner, and will switch the keyboard to show numbers and some symbols. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Press and hold the "0" button.
steps.content: Press and hold the "0" button. The 0 button is at the top of the keyboard. After a brief moment, a pop-up menu will appear above the 0 button. [9] X Research source If you're on an iPhone 6S or newer, make sure that you lightly press the 0 button, as pressing down on the screen will activate 3D Touch instead of the menu.

steps.title: Select the degree symbol.
steps.content: Select the degree symbol. Slide your finger over to the degree symbol, make sure that it is highlighted, and then release your finger. This will insert the degree symbol into the text that you're writing.

steps.title: Open an app that uses your device's keyboard.
steps.content: Open an app that uses your device's keyboard. The degree sign is available in the Symbols section of your Android's keyboard.

steps.title: Place your cursor where you want to type the degree symbol.
steps.content: Place your cursor where you want to type the degree symbol. Tap a text field (e.g., the Messages text field) into which you want to type the degree symbol. The keyboard should appear.

steps.title: Tap ?123 or !#1.
steps.content: Tap ?123 or !#1 . It's in the lower-left side of the keyboard. Doing so brings up the numbers and symbols view.

steps.title: Tap the secondary Symbols button.
steps.content: Tap the secondary Symbols button. It's the second button from the bottom on the left. On Google GBoard, it's the button that says "=\<". On Samsung Keyboard. it's the button that says "1/2".

steps.title: Tap the degree sign button.
steps.content: Tap the degree sign button. This will insert a degree sign into the text field.

steps.title: Copy the degree symbol.
steps.content: Copy the degree symbol. If you can't find the degree option in your Android's keyboard, do the following: Tap and hold this icon: ° Tap Copy when prompted. Tap a text field. Tap Paste when prompted.
